premise: A low-pressure system located about 625 miles (1005 km) south of Bermuda in the Atlantic Ocean has a 90 percent chance of becoming a subtropical depression or storm in the next 48 hours, the U.S. National Hurricane Center (NHC) said in its latest advisory on Friday. The low is forecast to move northwestward and then northward during the next couple of days, the NHC said. (Reporting by Arpan Varghese in Bangalore Editing by W Simon)
hypothesis: This will be the first hurricane of the season.

premise: Figures released today show that the number of organs donated by New Zealanders in 2006 has decreased by four to a new record low of 25. premise: Princess Augusta of Waldeck-Pyrmont (21 July 1824 – 4 September 1893) was a German noblewoman. premise:
How to spoil your cat
Develop a brushing ritual with your cat. Your cat will love the rhythmic, front-to-back motion of you brushing her coat. In addition to being a way to spoil your cat, brushing her coat serves several practical purposes: stimulating her skin, cleaning her fur, spreading natural oils throughout her coat, and preventing tangles.

How to refrigerate foods safely
Avoid packing your refrigerator tightly. Packing loosely allows the cold air to circulate. Use an appliance thermometer to monitor the real temperature inside your refrigerator and your freezer.
